item.title: Brittany add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "Faith is a never-ending pool of clarity, reaching far beyond the margins of consciousness. We all know more than we know we know. " -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "How happy is the blameless vestal’s lot! The world forgetting, by the world forgot. Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind! Each pray’r accepted, and each wish resign’d" -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description: "With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take me or leave me; or, as is the usual order of things, both." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "She was pleased to have him come and never sorry to see him go." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Brittany add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut
